News.45: {"title":"Ermias Legesse Appointed Deputy Chair of Baladera Council","content":"July 5, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Ermias Legesse was appointed the Deputy Chair of Baladera Council, a civic movement founded to protect the status quo of Addis Ababa as an autonomous federal city. The Baladera Council was founded by activist Eskinder Nega last year in response to a special interest claim by Oromo politicians over the city.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Ermias-Legesse.jpg","id":45}
News.46: {"title":"Conspiracy Theories Abound on Recent Killings","content":"July 4, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- The late Amhara region administrator Dr. Ambachew Mekonnen and two other top Amhara officials were killed shortly after 5pm Ethiopian time in Bahir Dar. General Seare Mekonnen and his associate General Gezae Aberra were killed about four hours later, around 9pm in Addis Ababa.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Demeke-Mekonnen-whereabout.jpg","id":46}
News.47: {"title":"Killer of General Seare Was Asking for a Transfer Weeks Ago","content":"July 2, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Reporting on the last moments of General Seare Mekonnen, Capital Ethiopia reported that General Seare's killer had requested that he be transferred to another durty weeks ago. General Seare's wife was also growing uncomfortable with the killer and was advising her husband to change him.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Seare-funeral-2.jpg","id":47}
News.48: {"title":"Dr Aregawi Berhe Says He Was Attacked and Detained in Mekelle","content":"July 2, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- The leader of Tigray Democratic Coalition Party (TAND), Dr. Aregawi Berhe, was attacked in Mekelle last week at the funeral of General Seare Mekonnen and General Gezae Aberra. According to a press statement Dr. Aregawi Berhe gave in Addis Ababa, he said he had to cut short his trip due fear of mob violence. He was later detained by local police and spent one night at Quwiha police station. Further, according to Dr. Aregawi, one member of TAND leadership, who came to see him, was severely attacked and poisoned by regional security forces and is recovering in Mekelle hospital.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Aregawi-4.jpg","id":48}
News.49: {"title":"Ethiopia Loses Its Third General in One Week","content":"June 28, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- General Abraha Woldemariam has reportedly passed away while in treatment in Bangkok, Thailand. General Abraha Woldemariam (also known as Quarter) was commander of the South Eastern Division of the Ethiopian Defense Forces until he was retired by Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Abraha-Seare-Gezae.jpg","id":49}
News.50: {"title":"Adem Mohammed Appointed Army Chief, Demelash Gebremichael Security Chief","content":"June 28, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed appointed General Adem Mohammed as Chief of Staff of the National Defense Forces, replacing the General Seare Mekonnen, who was gunned down in his home by his bodyguard earlier this week.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Adem-Demelash.jpg","id":50}
News.51: {"title":"Culminating a Turbulent Week, General Asaminew Tsige Shot Dead","content":"June 24, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Brigadier General Asaminew Tsige was shot dead by Ethiopian security forces, according to Ethiopian state media, ETV. This marks the end of a few tumultuous days, the ramification of which is yet to be seen in the days and months to come.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/General-Asaminew-Tsige-Dead.jpg","id":51}
News.52: {"title":"Amhara Administrator Ambachew Mekonnen Gunned Down","content":"June 23, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- The chief Administrator of Amhara region Dr. Ambachew Mekonnen was killed following attack by gunmen, as per Amhara TV report. The gunmen attacked the leaders of the Amhara state while the leaders were in a meeting.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Ambachew-Mekonnen-dead.jpg","id":52}
News.53: {"title":"Generals Seare Mekonnen and Gezae Aberra Dead","content":"June 23, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Ethiopian Army Chief of Staff General Seare Mekonnen was gunned down by one of his body guards in his home yesterday, according to media reports.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Seare-Mekonnen-Dead.jpg","id":53}
News.54: {"title":"General Seare Attacked, Coup Attempted in Amhara Region - PM Abiy","content":"June 22, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- A coup attempt was made on the regional government of Amhara, according to the office of the Prime Minister of Ethiopia. In appearance on Ethiopian Television (ETV), the PM press office head, Nigusu Tilahun, said certain organized groups conducted a coup attempt to overthrow the Amhara regional government. However, the group has failed in its attempt, said Nigusu Tilahun.","id":54}
News.55: {"title":"Ethiopia Shuts Down the Internet to Prevent Exam Leaks","content":"June 13, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Ethiopia has shut down the internet once again, this time to prevent exam papers from leaking out.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Internet-shutdown-2.jpg","id":55}
News.56: {"title":"Tigrayan People Losing Confidence in Ethiopian Federal System - Debretsion","content":"June 13, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- The Tigrayan people have been under constant attack since Abiy Ahmed was elected Prime Minister more than a year ago, says Dr. Debretsion Gebremichael, the Deputy Chief Administrator of Tigray.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Debre-5.jpg","id":56}
News.57: {"title":"PM Abiy Ahmed Consults Opposition on NEBE Board Nominees","content":"June 9, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed held discussions with opposition leaders to select nominees for board membership of the National Electoral Board of Ethiopia (NEBE).","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Opposition-Abiy.jpg","id":57}
News.58: {"title":"Ethiopia Avoiding International Commercial Loans - Ministry","content":"June 5, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- Ethiopian Ministry of Finance has disclosed the country is avoiding commercial loans due to worries of accumulated debt.","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Ahmed-Shidie.jpg","id":58}
News.59: {"title":"Ethiopian Government Considering to Enact New Media Law","content":"June 3, 2019 (Ezega.com) -- The Ethiopian government is considering to enact a new law to combat what it called disinformation and hate speech on social media","image":"https://www.ezega.com/userfiles/Social-media.jpg","id":59}
